titles.title: To provide that the Secretary of Commerce shall not set minimum or maximum amounts on grants made for the purpose of providing financial assistance to States whose tourism promotion needs have increased due to Hurricane Andrew, Hurricane Iniki, or other disasters.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H698-699)
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Transportation and Hazardous Materials.

bill.summary: 2/18/1993--Introduced. Prohibits the Secretary of Commerce, in providing grants to cover the costs of tourism promotion needs arising from Hurricane Andrew, Hurricane Iniki, or other disasters, from establishing or enforcing maximum or minimum dollar amounts of assistance to be made available to an individual or to a State.
